articles.description: Follow live text updates from day two of the fifth Test between India and England in Dharamsala.
articles.title: India resume on 135-1, just 83 behind England on day two

articles.description: Darwin Nunez has "quality coming out of his ears", says Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp after the player warmed up for Manchester City with two more goals.
articles.title: 'Quality coming out of his ears' - Klopp hails Nunez

articles.description: Christian Horner says it is "time to draw a line under" the controversy over accusations about his behaviour towards a female employee.
articles.title: Christian Horner: Red Bull boss says 'time to draw a line under' controversy over accusation about his behaviour

articles.description: After a thrilling 2-2 draw away to Benfica, BBC Scotland examines if Rangers are now favourites to make the quarter-finals of the Europa League given their strong home record.
articles.title: Does Ibrox factor give Rangers edge over Benfica?

articles.description: Aston Martin's Fernando Alonso sets the pace from George Russell and Max Verstappen in Saudi Arabian Grand Prix second practice.
articles.title: Saudi Arabian Grand Prix: Fernando Alonso fastest in second practice ahead of George Russell

articles.description: West Ham fall to defeat at Freiburg in the first leg of their Europa League last-16 tie.
articles.title: West Ham suffer first-leg Freiburg defeat

articles.description: Brighton lose 4-0 to a Roma side, revitalised by boss Daniele de Rossi in the first leg of their Europa League last-16 tie.
articles.title: Brighton taught a lesson by resurgent Roma

articles.description: Manchester City striker Erling Haaland 'doesn't mind' what Liverpool's Trent Alexander-Arnold says as he 'doesn't know' how it feels to win the Treble.
articles.title: Alexander-Arnold 'doesn't know' how Treble win feels

articles.description: Ireland head coach Andy Farrell says he does not pay attention to England's critics and insists they are an "unbelievably dangerous" team as they prepare to meet in Saturday's Six Nations game.
articles.title: England are 'unbelievably dangerous' - Farrell

articles.description: Chelsea forward Lauren James says 'everyone wants to win the quadruple' as Chelsea reach the Women's League Cup final.
articles.title: Everyone wants to win the quadruple - James
